data.title: Life and style
data.meta_description: Martina Navratilova, 53, tennis presenter, on her skirt falling down at Wimbledon and hating Dick Cheney
data.text:
Martina Navratilova was born in 1956 in Prague, in the then Czechoslovakia. In 1975 she defected to the US to pursue her tennis career. She was ranked world number one for seven years and won the Wimbledon singles title a record-breaking nine times. She retired after winning the mixed doubles at the 2006 US Open. She is covering this year's Wimbledon, which starts on Monday, for the Tennis Channel.

What is your greatest fear?

Dying, of course.

What is your earliest memory?

Cutting my hair at about two years old.

Which living person do you most admire, and why?

A great friend who at 65 has untreatable leukaemia - her positive attitude as well as her wisdom are a work of art.

What is the trait you most deplore in yourself?

Being too trusting.

What is the trait you most deplore in others?

Lying.

What was your most embarrassing moment?

My skirt falling down during one Wimbledon final.

What is your most treasured possession?

A locket with my mother's hair.

Where would you like to live?

Kenya.

What makes you unhappy?

Human or animal misery.

If you could bring something extinct back to life, what would you choose?

Sabre-toothed tiger, but I will settle for keeping what we have and not losing any more.

What is your favourite smell?

Ripe mangoes.

What is your favourite book?

The Fountainhead, by Ayn Rand.

Who would play you in the film of your life?

Anjelica Huston or Vanessa Redgrave.

What is your most unappealing habit?

Reading a newspaper in the presence of others.

What would be your fancy dress costume of choice?

Alexander the Great.

What is the worst thing anyone's said to you?

My sister telling me our mom died.

To whom would you most like to say sorry, and why?

My mother and sister for having left them when I defected, and a friend in Philadelphia for abandoning her.

What was the best kiss of your life?

Summer of 2008.

Which living person do you most despise?

Dick Cheney.

Which words or phrases do you most overuse?

"Wow", "Ridiculous", "Dammit".

What has been your biggest disappointment?

The direction my country took in 2000-2008. Compare that with Monica Lewinsky... I mean, really!

If you could edit your past, what would you change?

Having to leave my family behind.

If you could go back in time, where would you go?

To see what Earth looked like prior to human habitation.

When did you last cry, and why?

During this interview.

What is the closest you've come to death?

Nearly drowning at nine.

What single thing would improve the quality of your life?

Finding my soul mate.

What keeps you awake at night?

Menopause.

Tell us a secret

Thelma and Louise live!!!
